Class SameGameTile

java.lang.Object
com.aoopproject.games.samegame.SameGameTile
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameEntity
public class SameGameTile extends Object implements GameEntity
Represents a single tile in the SameGame. Each tile has a color and can be considered empty if removed.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description
    SameGameTile(Color color)
    Creates a new tile with a specific color.

  • Constructor Details

    • SameGameTile

      public SameGameTile(Color color)
      Creates a new tile with a specific color. Initially, the tile is not empty.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the tile. Cannot be null.

  • Method Details

      The tile's color.

    • setEmpty

      public void setEmpty()
      Marks this tile as empty (removed).

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Description copied from interface: GameEntity
      Indicates whether this entity represents an empty or non-interactive space on the grid. Some games might use special "empty" entity objects rather than nulls in the grid.
      Specified by:
      isEmpty in interface GameEntity
      Returns:
      true if the entity is considered empty or a placeholder, false otherwise.

    • getVisualRepresentation

      public Object getVisualRepresentation()
      The visual representation for a SameGameTile is its color. Views can use this color to render the tile. If the tile is empty, it might return null or a special placeholder.
      Specified by:
      getVisualRepresentation in interface GameEntity
      Returns:
      The Color of the tile, or null if empty (or a default empty color).

    • copy

      public SameGameTile copy()
      Creates a copy of this tile.
      Returns:
      A new SameGameTile instance with the same color and empty state.
